slides.title: Data Center Energy Consumption: The Numbers
slides.ironicClosing: By 2030, data centers will consume as much as Japan. All year round. Every year.

citations.text: Data centers consumed 415 TWh in 2024, IEA projects 945 TWh by 2030
Datacenter electricity growing 15% annually, US consumption up 130% by 2030

slides.title: The Cost of Training: GPT-4

metrics.label: Energia consumata (alimenta San Francisco per 3 giorni)

paragraphs: 40x the consumption of GPT-3
slides.ironicClosing: San Francisco in the dark for 3 days, but at least ChatGPT knows how to write poetry.

citations.text: GPT-4 training cost $100M, consumed 50 GWh, used 25K A100 GPUs for 90-100 days
GPT-4 consumed 51,773-62,319 MWh, over 40x GPT-3 consumption

slides.title: The Cost of Inference: Per Query
slides.intro: How much does a query to ChatGPT consume?
slides.ironicClosing: Every time you ask ChatGPT to write an email, a light bulb cries.

citations.text: GPT-4o consumes ~0.3 watt-hours per typical query, 2.5-40 Wh for complex queries
ChatGPT uses 10x more electricity than traditional Google search

slides.title: Training vs Inference: Who Wins?

metrics.label: Tutte le query AI generative nel 2025
Server AI sul totale energia datacenter (2024)
Previsione AI workload sul totale datacenter (2030)

paragraphs: The winner: Inference. Future growth will be driven by usage, not by training.
slides.ironicClosing: Training a model is expensive. Using it billions of times a day costs even more.

citations.text: All generative AI queries consume 15 TWh in 2025, will use 347 TWh by 2030
AI servers 24% of datacenter energy 2024, projected 35-50% by 2030

Of which: 78% renewables, 22% nuclear

citations.text: US datacenters: 40%+ natural gas, 24% renewables, 20% nuclear, 15% coal (2024)
US hosts 90% of hyperscaler carbon-free contracts: 78% renewables, 22% nuclear

slides.title: The Return of Nuclear Power
slides.name: Three Mile Island + Microsoft
slides.tagline: Il Deal che Ha Fatto Storia
slides.ironicClosing: From the 1979 incident to Microsoft's cloud. Redemption arc completed.

citations.text: Microsoft 20-year PPA for 835 MW Three Mile Island restart, $1.6B investment, 2028 launch
Three Mile Island restart creates 3,400 jobs, $16B GDP impact, $3B+ taxes

slides.title: Small Modular Reactors (SMR): Timeline
paragraphs: 2026: China Linglong One (ACP100) - The world's first commercial land-based SMR
2026: TerraPower - NRC approval expected (operational 2030)
2029: Westinghouse - Planned commercial deployments
Global pipeline: 22 GW SMR projects ($176 billion investment)
US DOE: $900 million to accelerate Gen-III+ deployment
slides.ironicClosing: China launches the first SMR while the USA is still approving permits.

citations.text: China Linglong One SMR scheduled commercial operation 2026, first land-based SMR
22 GW SMR pipeline globally, $176B potential investment

slides.title: Nuclear Fusion: The Dream
slides.subtitle: When energy will be infinite (maybe)
paragraphs: 2025 breakthrough: China EAST tokamak - 1,066 seconds of steady-state plasma
2025 record: HL-3 Tokamak - 117MÂ°C ion temp, 160MÂ°C electron temp
2035: ITER online (France) - world's largest tokamak
2045-2050: DEMO reactors (Korea, EU, Japan, China)
Late 2050s: First realistic commercialization
slides.ironicClosing: Nuclear fusion: 30 years into the future from 1950. Another 30 years into the future.

citations.text: China EAST achieved 1,066 seconds steady-state plasma January 2025
ITER expected online 2035, DEMO reactors 2045-2050, commercial late 2050s

slides.title: Fusion: Realistic Timeline
paragraphs: 2030s: Some private ventures (Commonwealth Fusion) aim for commercialization in the early 2030s.
2040s-2050s: First operational commercial fusion plants (expert consensus)
2060-2070: Large-scale deployment of Tokamak reactors
2100: Fusion could reach 10-20% of global electricity generation
slides.ironicClosing: Your great-grandchildren might see the merger. Maybe.

citations.text: First commercial fusion plants 2040s-2050s, tokamak deployment 2060-2070, 20% generation by 2100
Commonwealth Fusion targets commercialization early 2030s, but late 2050s more realistic

slides.title: Energy Costs: Future Projections

metrics.label: Costo fusion dipende da tech choices future

paragraphs: Low-cost energy? Maybe by the end of the century, if all goes well.
Safe nuclear? Safer SMRs, intrinsically safe fusion
slides.ironicClosing: Cheap and safe energy by 2100. In the meantime, natural gas.

citations.text: EU DEMO fusion LCOE projection $121/MWh, costs highly uncertain

slides.title: The Challenge: Is It Sustainable?
paragraphs: Problem: AI energy demand grows by 15% annually
Problem: Intermittent renewables (night, no wind)
Problem: Slow nuclear to deploy (permissions, construction)
Problem: Grid infrastructure not ready for the load
Opportunity: AI can optimize the energy sector itself
Opportunity: Accelerates investments in clean energy
slides.ironicClosing: AI consumes too much. But it could also solve the problem. Maybe.

citations.text: AI set to drive surging electricity demand while offering potential to transform energy sector

slides.title: Optimization Strategies
slides.intro: How to make AI more energy-efficient:
items: Datacenter cooling: Liquid cooling, free cooling, immersion
Renewable integration: Datacenter vicino a fonti rinnovabili
Workload scheduling: Training when there is excess solar/wind
Edge computing: Local inference to reduce datacenter load
slides.ironicClosing: Optimizing helps. But it's not enough when scaling from billions to trillions of queries.

slides.title: Forecasts 2026-2030
paragraphs: 2026: Primo SMR commerciale (China), piÃ¹ nuclear restart deals
2027: Renewables exceed 30% of datacenter mix
2028: Three Mile Island online, other restarts in the USA
2029-2030: SMR deployment in the USA and Europe, fusion still in R&D
2026 will be the year when energy becomes the real bottleneck of AI.
slides.ironicClosing: The AI scale-up will come to a halt. Not for lack of ideas, but for lack of gigawatts.

citations.text: Utilities grapple with multibillion question: How much AI datacenter power demand is real

slides.title: What We Learned
items: Data center consumption: 415 TWh (2024) â†’ 945 TWh (2030)
Training costs a lot (GPT-4: $100M, 50 GWh), inference scales more (347 TWh by 2030)
Energy mix: USA 40% gas, Europe 50% renewables
Nuclear comeback: Three Mile Island 2028, SMR China 2026
Fusion: great idea, but commercially viable only 2050+ (realistically)
Cheap and safe energy? End of the century, if all goes well.
slides.ironicClosing: AI is hungry. For data, for chips, and above all for terawatts.
